a cliff face that drops to the plains
a game of cards rests on a good one
stand on one and watch the boats go by
a sharp mind sees through a weak one
keep a straight face to pull one off
a ridge of earth at the bend of a stream
a small house built in the woods
stay in one on a ski trip
a warm fire burns in the big stone hearth
the roof has a steep pitch to shed the snow
thick logs form the walls and the frame
a group or club may meet in one
it sits by a lake or at the foot of the hills
hang your coat and warm your hands
a grand one has rooms for a crowd
a hunt or fish trip starts from one
a small still pool of fresh clean wet
frogs sit on the pad leaves and croak
a duck glides on its calm flat face
kids toss bread to the birds at its edge
it is less wide than a lake
a green film can grow on the top
gold fish swim in a yard one
a rock tossed in makes rings spread out
reeds and grass line its soft banks
drain it and just mud stays at the base
a small round fruit that grows on a vine
squash them down and the juice makes wine
green or red or deep dark blue
pick a bunch from the stem and eat them fresh
they grow in rows on a sun drenched slope
dry them out and they shrink to small sweet bits
a jam or spread can be made from the juice
they come in tight packed groups on the stem
a glass of their juice is sweet and cold
some say the best ones come from old vines
a small soft bag that holds your things
pull the string to close it up
a coin purse is a type of one
a pack on the front of a vest is one
some beasts have one on their front to hold young
tuck it in your belt or strap
a mail bag is a large one
fill it with herbs or stones
the flap on top keeps the rain out
reach in and grab what you need
a long thin trench dug in the ground
it runs by the side of the road
rain drains in and flows down its bed
dig one to move the wet from a field
a car can slide off in and get stuck
jump it to cross from one field to the next
some are dry and some are full of muck
a crew with spades digs one out each year
it can mean to drop or leave a thing fast
a moat is a wide deep form of one
the hard thin shell on the edge of bread
bake it long and it turns dark and crisp
the earth has one on its top like a skin
a pie has one on the base and on top
break through it to reach the soft part

a fresh loaf has a warm one that cracks
roll the dough flat and press it in the pan
a thick one holds the fill of a pot pie
a sheet of ice or snow forms one on top
a small flat jar that fits in your coat
take a sip from one on a cold hike
the cap screws on to stop a spill
steel or glass can form its shell
it holds just a few sips of drink
slip one in your hip or chest fold
a lab has a round glass one on the bench
warm your hands and your gut with what is in it
a curved shape lets it rest on your thigh
fill it up and stash it for the road
a hard clear stone found in the ground
it comes in shades of white pink and grey
a clock runs on a thin slice of it
veins of it run through rock like streaks
it is one of the most seen gems on earth
a chunk of it can have sharp bright points
sand is made of worn down bits of this
heat and stress in the earth form it
a split rock may hold sparks of it
new age shops sell chunks of it for luck
a thin warm soup made from bones and meat
sip it slow from a cup or bowl
it is the base of most good soups
cook it for hours to draw out the taste
salt and herbs give it the right note
strain it clear through a fine mesh
it warms you through on a sick day
a stock pot on the stove holds it
it can be made from fowl or beef or greens
the smell of it fills the whole house
a long thin line of high ground
it runs like a spine through the hills
hike on top of one and see both sides
the peak of a roof makes one
a range of them runs on for miles
wind blows hard on its bare crest
snow may cap the one up north
a trail runs the length of its back
the sun hits one side first at dawn
a plowed field shows rows of these in the dirt
to hold or grip a thing in your hand
reach out and take a firm one
a strong one keeps you from a fall
a child wraps small hands in a tight one
it can mean to see the point of a thought
let go and your hold on it breaks
squeeze hard and the hold grows more firm
a branch in a storm needs a good one
it is what you do when you catch a thrown ball
a weak one means the thing may slip free
a flat plate on a wall with words cut in
it marks a spot where a thing took place
a doc may give you one for your work
a build may have one near the front door
the stuff that builds up on your teeth is called this
clean it off with a brush twice a day
brass or bronze are the most used types
it shows who or what or when
a hall of fame has rows and rows of them
a small one on a desk holds your name
a small thin stream that winds through the woods
step on stones to cross it dry
kids wade in and splash on hot days
it feeds a big stream down the way
the sound of it is a soft low hum
trout may hide in the pools by the bend
its banks are lined with moss and ferns
it dries to just a drip in the drought
a bridge of logs spans it at the trail
rain swells it to a rush in the spring
a trap set to catch a beast
a loop of wire laid on the ground
step in one and it pulls tight
a drum type has wires stretched on the base
the sharp snap of one marks the beat
set one on a trail where game runs
it is a trick or a lure that draws you in
the more you fight the more it grips
a fox or hare may find one in the brush
free your foot with care or it cuts deep
to put out a fire or a thirst
drink deep and your need for it stops
a cold glass of drink does this on a hot day
douse a flame and this is what you do
cool hot steel in a tank and this is the word
the fire crew works to do this to a blaze
it means to end or kill a want or need
naught but a long cold drink will do this
the urge to drink stops once you have done this
a deep well of spring flow can do this for a town
a sled pulled by beasts through the snow
bells ring as it glides on the ice
a big man in red rides one once a year
the blades slide smooth on the packed white ground
hitch a team of deer to the front
a fur wrap keeps you warm in the back
it is the main ride for a cold land
the crack of a whip starts the team
a hill of snow makes a fast run for one
the chime of its bells means the cold feast is near
a black dust left by fire and smoke
it coats the flue and the stones round the hearth
wipe it off and your hands turn dark
it stains the air in old mill towns
breathe it in and your lungs go bad
a sweep cleans it from the stack
it builds up thick if you do not clean
the smell of it clings to brick and stone
a fire that burns cool leaves more of it
rain streaks it down the side of a wall
a small group of trees in one spot
walk through one and the shade keeps you cool
a peach or plum one yields fruit each year
the trunks stand in neat rows or a wild bunch
birds and deer find a home in one
the leaves form a roof of green
it is not as big as a full woods
a path winds through the soft light
a blessed one was a place of old rites
sit on the ground in one and find peace
the skin and fur stripped from a beast
a fur man dries one on a frame
it keeps you warm as a coat or rug
trade in them built the north lands long back
tan it and it turns to a soft hide
a mink or fox gives a fine one
rain or stones can strike you in a hard one
stack them up and sell at the post
the fur side feels thick and warm
stretch it flat and scrape it clean
a small clip that holds two parts shut
snap it on a chain or a strap
a belt or bag has one at the front
press it and the two sides lock
it can be made of brass or steel
a hand shake is a warm one of hands
a pearl strand links at the back with one
it clicks when it shuts and pops when it springs
a brooch has one on the back to pin it on
a firm one holds a thing safe and close
a grand meal spread out on a long desk
friends and kin come from far to eat
the board groans with roast meat and bread
a toast is raised at the start of one
a fall or cold time one marks the year
eat till your belt feels tight
a whole bird sits at the heart of it
wine and song flow free at the best ones
a king once held one that went on for days
clear the plates and you still feel full
a deep steep cut in the rock made by a stream
look down from the rim and the drop is vast
the walls are sheer on both sides
a flow carved it out through the years
a bridge may span it at its most thin point
a hike down takes you past bands of old rock
a raft ride through one can be wild
mist hangs in the gap at dawn
it can mean to eat far too much at once
the roar of the falls fills the whole gap
raw rock that holds bits of fine stuff
dig it up from deep in a mine
melt it down to get the good parts out
a vein of it runs through the stone
gold or steel starts as a lump of this
a cart hauls it up to the top
the more dense the good stuff the more it is worth
a forge needs a good batch of it
crush it first and then heat it up
the earth holds great stores of it down low
a shell fish that lives in the sand
dig for them at the beach when the tide goes out
the two halves of its shell snap shut
steam them in a pot and they pop wide
a thick soup made of them warms the gut
it sits still on the sea floor and waits
pry one with a blade to eat it raw
it can mean to go mute and say naught
a pearl can form in the rare kind
the brine of the sea gives them their taste
a bad feel you get when you do wrong
it weighs on your mind like a stone
a court finds you this or not
it eats at you till you say what you did
a look on your face may show it
it is the twin of shame in the gut
a clean heart has none of this
own up and the load of it lifts
some hide it but it shows through in time
a trip of it can change how you act
a row of thick green shrubs that forms a wall
trim it flat on top with big shears
it marks where your land ends
a bird may nest deep in its base
it grows thick and blocks the view
a maze can be built from tall rows of one
it can mean to play it safe and not risk all
a gate in it lets you walk through
the leaves turn brown if you do not tend it
a low one lines the path to the front door
a small cut or groove in a hard edge
carve one in a stick to keep a count
a belt has a row of them for size
a step up in rank or skill is one
it fits two parts so they lock in place
a gap in a ridge where the trail goes through
file one in the wood to join two beams
each win adds one to your score
a bow string sits in one at the tip
a key has small ones cut in its side
ride the waves on a board near the shore
the white foam curls and breaks on the sand
a wet suit keeps you warm in the cold swell
stand up and glide on the crest of a wave
the roar of it fills the coast
a storm far off sends big ones to the beach
wax the board so your feet do not slip
a reef break sends the best ones up
the rush of it draws you back each day
salt spray stings your face as you ride
a long flat deck that juts out from the shore
walk to the end and look at the sea
a boat ties up at its side
fish from the edge with a pole and a line
thick posts hold it up out of the waves
a plank walk leads you past the surf
a fair or shops may line its length
the wood gets grey and worn from the salt air
a storm can rip parts of it free
sit on the edge and let your legs hang down
a small bar that holds a door or gate shut
lift it up and the door swings free
a click means it has caught
it is less strong than a full lock
a child can work one with a small hand
a hook type drops in a loop to hold
a screen door has a thin one on the side
close the gate and let it drop in place
fix one on the fence to keep the dog in
a loose one means the wind can blow it wide
a tool that grips and turns a bolt
a twist of it sets the nut loose or tight
a set of them hangs on a peg in the shop
the jaw of it clamps down on steel
a pipe one has long jaws for round things
a hard pull or twist of the arm is one
it takes the right size for each bolt
turn it the wrong way and you strip the thread
a tool box has a few of these at least
the grunt of force as you push on one says the bolt is stuck
a soft thing full of holes that soaks up wet
squeeze it out and use it to scrub
the sea has ones that grow on the reef
a bath one sits by the tub
it puffs back to its shape when you let go
a cake type is light and full of air
it cleans the grime off a dish or a top
one of these can hold a lot of its weight in drink
wring it dry and start once more
a dried sea one feels rough in your hand
a long dry spell with no rain at all
the ground cracks and the crops fail
wells go dry and streams shrink to naught
herds thin out when the grass dies
a state may ban the use of spare flow
the sky stays clear for weeks on end
pray for rain when one hits
the dust blows free on the bare land
a fire risk grows in the dry brush
it tests the grit of all who live on the land
a ridge of rock or shell just down in the sea
bright fish swim through its nooks and gaps
a ship can run on one and crack its hull
warm clear seas have the best ones
the small beasts that build it grow slow
a mask and tube lets you see one from the top
it shields the shore from the worst of the waves
a bleach of one turns it white and dead
dive down and the hues take your breath
guard it well or the whole chain of life fails
a sharp quick burst of strong wind
it hits you hard and then it fades
hold your hat or it blows right off
a door slams shut from one
leaves spin up in a wild swirl
it can knock you off your stride
a kite jerks up when one comes through
the flag snaps straight when one blows
a calm day breaks when one rolls in
dust and trash fly in its brief rush
a case that holds a blade safe at your side
slide the edge in and it clicks shut
it guards the sharp part so you do not get cut
a belt loop holds one on your hip
pull it free when you need the tool
a long one fits a sword and a short one fits a small blade
it can be made of hide or hard cloth
the tip is closed so the point does not poke through
strap it on and your hands stay free
a fine one shows the craft of the one who made it
a long strip of cloth worn round the neck
knit one from warm wool for the cold months
it keeps the chill wind off your throat
wrap it once or twice and tuck the ends in
a silk one adds style to a plain dress
hang it on a hook by the door
red or blue or striped they come in all sorts
pull it tight when the frost bites hard
a gift of one shows you thought of their warmth
the fringe at each end sways when you walk
the skin on the top of your head
hair grows from it thick or thin
a bad sun burn makes it peel and flake
rub it and you feel the bone of your skull
a bald man shows his bare one to the world
it can itch when dry or stressed
a cut on one bleeds a lot
a hat shields it from the hot sun
scratch it when you try to think hard
wash it well to keep the roots clean
a sea beast with long arms and a soft form
it shoots ink to hide from those that hunt it
its arms grab fish and pull them to its beak
some grow as large as a boat
chop it up and fry it in rings
it swims by push of a jet of sea
its eyes are large and round like a plate
the flesh is white and firm when cooked
it can change its hue in a flash
deep dark depths are where the big ones live
a tall white bird with long thin legs
it stands in the marsh and waits for fish
a folk tale says it brings new born babes
its beak is long and sharp and red
it builds a huge nest on top of a roof
it flies south when the cold months come
it wades through the low wet ground with slow steps
a pair of them will mate for life
it snaps up frogs from the edge of a pond
its wide wings spread out like a cape
rain that turns to ice as it falls
it coats the road in a slick glaze
a storm of it stings your face like sand
it is not quite snow and not quite rain
drive slow when it hits or you will slide
it taps on the glass like small sharp stones
a grey sky dumps it for hours on end
salt and grit help melt it off the streets
it forms a thin crust on each branch and rail
the worst kind of storm to walk through at night
a large white bird that glides on a lake
its long curved neck bends like a smooth arc
it pairs with one mate for its whole life
the young ones are grey and turn white in time
it can hiss and bite if you come too close
a tale says it sings once right at the end
its grace on the waves is a fine sight
the queen of the land owns all wild ones
it tucks its head back when it sleeps
a flock of them drifts like clouds on the pond
a strong rush that moves fast and hard
the sea makes one in a big storm
a crowd can do one and push through a gate
the force of it sweeps all in its path
it comes on quick and fades just as fast
a bolt of charge through a wire is one
hold firm or it will knock you down flat
the tide makes one twice each day
the troops made one at the front lines
